comments.body:
ðŸ‘ Makes more sense! Also I think the `toEither` in `unsafeRun` could be replaced with:
```scala
def unsafeRun[E, A](io: IO[E, A]): A = 
  unsafeRunSync(io).leftMap(FiberFailure).fold(throw _, identity)
```
Done! ðŸ‘ (Well, almost, types didn't quite work out since leftMap only maps over the `E`, but I got close.)

comments.body:
As long as we are making these mega-changes, I suggest the following:

`Failure` => `Checked`
`Exception` => `Unchecked`
This is kind of veering off the terminology you described [in that ticket](https://github.com/scalaz/scalaz-zio/issues/330), isn't that going to muddy the waters?

It's true. I just wrote up a [v2](
https://github.com/scalaz/scalaz-zio/issues/330) that simplifies terminology.
